title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Nexperia's China unit switches to local firms for wafer supplies
Coca-Cola India sees 46.3% profit surge in FY25, revenue Up 7%
items.summary:
- FY25 consolidated profit ₹615.03 crore, up 46.3%, on revenue ₹5,042.56 crore (+7%); total income ₹5,171.48 crore (+7.7%).
- FY24: net profit ₹420.3 crore; revenue from operations ₹4,713.38 crore; expenses rose 2.8% to ₹4,328.37 crore.
- Royalty to US parent rose 9.65%; tax expense up 33%; company controlled via Coca-Cola South Asia (India) Holdings Ltd; HCCB divested 40% stake.

items.title: India's defence shipbuilding sector stands at multi-decade transformation threshold: Report
items.summary:
- Defence shipbuilding in India is at a multi-decade transformation, driven by naval capex, policy stimulus, and Indian Ocean imperatives (₹2.3+ trillion in projects).
- The ₹697 billion Shipbuilding and Maritime Development Package funds finance, guarantees, and eight coastal clusters to boost domestic build and push for a top-five global shipbuilder by 2047.
- Exports reached ₹236 billion in FY25; 75% of defence procurement is domestic, benefiting yards like Mazagon Dock, Cochin Shipyard and Garden Reach and increasing indigenisation.

items.title: Shree Cement to invest ₹2,000 cr in Maharashtra manufacturing unit
items.summary:
- ₹2,000 crore to build a 2 MTPA cement plant in Chandrapur, Maharashtra, as part of a plan to lift capacity from 68 to 80 MTPA; land acquisition near complete, ToR issued, EC awaited; construction ~2 years.
- Funded from internal accruals; cash reserves >₹5,000 crore and no borrowings; CM Devendra Fadnavis attended; Shree Cement already runs a Pune grinding unit.
- Target 100 MTPA by ~2030 after 80 MTPA; Shree Cement is among India's top three cement producers; Raipur plant closure due to worker non-cooperation.

items.title: India-Oman CEPA opens new avenues in trade, mobility, investment: Piyush Goyal
JERA secures govt subsidy for US ammonia imports
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- JERA won a 15-year government subsidy to cover the price gap between ammonia and coal for importing from its planned Blue Point project in Louisiana, slated to start in 2029.
- The Blue Point JV with CF Industries and Mitsui will produce **low-carbon ammonia** and supply JERA’s Hekinan plant and other buyers, with plans for up to 20% co-firing by 2029.
- Mitsui said government support would cover the price gap; it will supply about 280,000 tons annually from Blue Point to Hokkaido Electric Power, Mitsubishi UBE Cement and Tosoh by fiscal 2030 to cut emissions.

items.title: AI-driven data centres to lift demand for gensets in India: Cummins
JHS Svendgaard to invest ₹25 crore in Kala Amb unit
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- JHS Svendgaard Laboratories Ltd will invest ₹25 crore to expand its manufacturing base at Kala Amb, Himachal Pradesh.
- The new ~100,000 sq ft unit on a five-acre site is expected to be completed by 2027, creating 500–600 local jobs and potentially up to ₹100 crore in annual revenue.
- The project supports *Make in India* and strengthens the group as a contractor for global brands in *oral care products*.

items.title: AI adoption by MSMEs could unlock $500 billion value for India: Report
Copper and India’s strategic leap: Securing the backbone of a digital and electric economy
REC forms new subsidiary for Maharashtra project
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- REC Ltd formed a wholly-owned subsidiary, *Balsane Power Transmission*, via RECPDCL to develop the Maharashtra intra-state transmission project.
- The SPV has been established with authorised and paid-up capital of ₹5 lakh and has not commenced commercial operations.
- After a winning bidder is selected under the **tariff-based bidding** framework, *Balsane Power Transmission* will be transferred to the developer with its assets and liabilities.

items.title: Pfizer, Cipla enter exclusive marketing agreement for select medicines in India
Jaya Hind expands Chennai die-casting plant with ₹200Cr
items.summary:
- Jaya Hind expands its *Chennai* die-casting facility with about ₹200 crore to add high‑pressure capacity and serve domestic and export orders.
- The project includes a new 13,000 sq m shed and in‑house processes like *machining*, *powder coating*, and *heat treatment* to enable end‑to‑end manufacturing.
- Prasan Firodia, MD, says the expansion will drive *vertical integration* and boost annual capacity to around 20,000 tonnes, serving customers such as *Cummins*, *Generac*, and *TVS Motor*.

items.title: FMCG and auto majors ramp up manufacturing capacity amid demand growth and GST gains
Shree Cement declares lockout at Chhattisgarh plant; production hit by 10,000 tonnes a day
items.summary:
- Shree Cement has declared a *lockout* at its Baloda Bazar, Chhattisgarh plant effective 18 December 2025 due to non-cooperation from workmen.
- Based on current operations, the lockout could lead to a loss of about *10,000 tonnes per day* of cement production, with the financial impact yet to be quantified.
- The company says all assets at the plant are insured, but no timeline for resolution or resumption has been provided.

items.title: HCC bags ₹901cr tunnel contract from NFR
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary: - HCC–VCCL JV won a ₹901-crore tunnel contract from *Northeast Frontier Railway* for New Tunnel 28 on the Tupul–Imphal line.\n- The scope includes a 3.5 km main tunnel, design, E&M, ventilation and ballast-less track with all systems and commissioning.\n- The project timeline is not disclosed; as of Nov 2025, HCC's order book stood at ₹13,152 crore with transport projects making up around 63% of it.

items.title: India–Sweden ties gain momentum with sustainability focus
items.author: Nisha Shukla
items.summary:
- The India–Sweden Sustainability Day accelerated a long-standing partnership toward *climate action* and **sustainability**, framing India as a strategic partner rather than just a market.
- Bilateral trade (~$17bn) and Swedish investment are expanding across *manufacturing*, *mobility*, defence, digital and urban solutions, with a potential *free trade agreement* seen as a game-changer.
- Priorities include *green hydrogen*, circular economy and co‑innovation supported by Team Sweden, with policy predictability highlighted as crucial.

items.title: Andhra's rare-earth corridor and India’s clean energy
items.author: Samdani MN, TNN
items.summary:
- *Andhra Pradesh's* 974km coast contains high‑grade *monazite* (55–60% REOs, 8–10% thorium) and ~30–35% of India’s monazite reserves, embedded in heavy‑mineral sands.
- APMDC, *IREL* and Centre policies (leases, a 10,000 tpa plant and *PLI*/NCMM pilots) aim to build domestic *REE* processing and waste‑recovery capacity.
- With modern extraction and scale‑up, Andhra could cut import dependence dramatically and power EVs, renewables, semiconductors and defence.

items.title: Google aims to cut Nvidia's software edge with Meta's help
items.summary:
- Google is building *TorchTPU* to make its *TPUs* fully compatible with *PyTorch*, targeting the software gap that favors Nvidia's *CUDA*-optimized GPUs.
- The company is working with *Meta*, may open-source parts, and is selling TPUs directly into customer data centers to speed adoption.
- Success could lower switching costs, weaken Nvidia's software lock-in, and reshape cloud *AI infrastructure* and vendor dynamics.

items.title: Republicans Criticize Intel's Testing of China-Linked Tools
items.summary:
- Reuters reported that **Intel** tested chipmaking tools from *ACM Research*, a firm with China ties and U.S.-sanctioned units, for its 14A process, though Intel says it is not using the tools now and complies with U.S. law.
- Republican lawmakers warned such testing threatens *national security*, could enable technology transfer or sabotage, and urged legislation to bar Chinese-linked equipment for subsidized chipmakers.
- Intel stressed strict security controls and dialogue with policymakers while *ACM Research* denied allegations or did not comment, leaving lawmakers to press for tighter rules.

items.title: TVS Supply appeals NCLT order on ZTE insolvency
items.summary:
- *TVS Supply Chain Solutions* has moved *NCLAT* after a *NCLT* bench dismissed its Section 9 *insolvency* petition against *ZTE*, citing pre‑existing disputes and reconciliations.
- The *NCLAT* registrar granted TVS time to cure defects and directed that the plea be listed for a bench hearing.
- TVS alleges a default of *₹4.27 crore* (2012–2019) amid invoice discrepancy claims by ZTE (about *₹5.60 crore*), testing creditor remedies under the IBC.

items.title: AI helps semiconductor startups compete with chip giants
items.author: Alenjith K Johny, ETtech
items.summary:
- *AI* is enabling semiconductor startups to shorten *design cycles* by months, automate scripting (from a week to 2–3 hours) and reduce team sizes, leveling the playing field with large chipmakers.
- Startups use *AI* to parse extensive technical specs and speed testing, saving about 20–25% of design time, aided by vendors like Cadence and Synopsys embedding ML in tools.
- Key barriers remain: high *foundry* costs, limited data availability and *IP/security* risks when proprietary code is exposed to AI models.

items.title: UK court grants Acer/Asus/Hisense interim licence vs Nokia
items.summary:
- London's High Court ruled that *Acer*, *Asus* and *Hisense* are entitled to an interim licence against *Nokia* pending determination of fair, reasonable and non-discriminatory (*FRAND*) terms.
- Judge James Mellor set a temporary royalty of *$0.365 per device*, between the companies' $0.03 proposal and Nokia's $0.69 demand.
- The decision underscores UK courts' ability to set global *FRAND* terms and may shape other telecom patent disputes.

items.title: SpaceX loses contact with Starlink satellite after mishap
items.summary:
- *Starlink* lost contact after an in‑orbit anomaly at ~418 km, leaving the satellite tumbling, dropping about 4 km, shedding a *small number* of debris and expected to *reenter within weeks*.  
- Space‑tracking firm LeoLabs reported *tens* of likely fragments, and SpaceX is working with the U.S. Space Force and NASA; the altitude drop suggests an internal explosion rather than a collision.  
- The event highlights rising *orbital congestion* from mega‑constellations and reinforces calls for international *coordination* and traffic rules to reduce collision risk.

items.title: Taiwan launches WTO complaint over Canadian steel tariffs
items.summary:
- **Taiwan** has requested *WTO* dispute consultations with **Canada** over *tariff rate quotas (TRQs)*, a **50% surtax** on certain steel imports and a *25% global duty* on steel-derivative goods.
- The complaint says these measures, announced since June, appear inconsistent with Canada's *WTO* obligations and challenge multiple provisions.
- Parties have 60 days to seek a settlement in consultations, after which Taiwan may request formal panel *adjudication*, risking trade escalation.

items.title: NTPC plans 244 GW by 2037 at ₹7 lakh cr
items.summary:
- *NTPC* unveiled a roadmap to reach **244 GW** capacity by 2037 with an estimated capex of **₹7 lakh crore**.
- The plan builds on **32 GW** under construction and targets **149 GW by 2032**, expanding into **storage, pumped storage, nuclear, green hydrogen** and chemicals.
- Under the Ministry of Power, the expansion will bolster India's electricity supply, with **over 85,000 MW** currently in operation and ongoing solar additions by subsidiaries.

items.title: JSW Energy to double Salboni to 3200 MW
items.summary:
- **JSW Energy** announced plans to double the **Salboni** thermal project in *West Bengal* to **3,200 MW**, with total investment around **₹40,000 crore**, among the state's largest private-sector power investments.
- Expansion will be executed in phases after regulatory clearances and fuel tie-ups, building on the ongoing **1,600 MW** (2x800 MW) phase.
- The initial 1,600 MW plant has a 25-year PPA with WBSEDCL and uses domestic coal under the *SHAKTI B policy*, as part of JSW's eastern India energy push.

items.title: Gujarat DyCM inaugurates INOXGFL solar & wind plants
items.summary: - *Gujarat DyCM Harsh Sanghavi* inaugurated INOXGFL's 3 GW Bavla solar module facility and Inox Wind's 1.2 GW nacelle/hub plant near Ahmedabad.\n- The Bavla 3 GW solar module facility is an investment of about *₹400 crore*, while the nacelle/hub plant is about *₹150 crore*.\n- Inox Solar commissioned the first phase of a 3 GW facility with automated *TOPCon* and *bifacial* modules, with plans to reach 11 GW module and 8 GW cell capacity by FY27 and ~*₹20,000 crore* annual revenue by FY28.

items.title: RCPL takes majority stake in Udhaiyams Agro Foods
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - **RCPL** will take a majority stake in *Udhaiyams Agro Foods*, with the original owners retaining a minority stake.\n- The deal places *Udhaiyams* in RCPL’s branded staples portfolio and aims for nationwide distribution across India.\n- Promoters S Sudhakar and S Dinakar will remain minority stakeholders to support future growth.

items.title: India inks CEPA with Oman; gets zero-duty access on 99% of exports
Centre to begin work on ISM 2.0, says S Krishnan
Olectra penalized ₹2.58 cr for Telangana EV plant delay
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Olectra Greentech was slapped with a penalty of **₹2.58 crore** (including GST) by *Telangana Industrial Infrastructure Corporation (TGIIC)* for delays in the Hyderabad-based **greenfield EV manufacturing facility**. 
- The penalty, for the period **Nov 12, 2023 to Nov 11, 2025**, was imposed under the sale agreement signed in **Nov 2021** after TGIIC invoked the clause due to delays and the company sought extensions. 
- Olectra says some commercial operations have begun within the timeline, claims no material financial/operational impact, and must remit the penalty within seven days of the order.

items.title: Cyient Semiconductors buys stake in Kinetic for up to $93M
items.summary:
- Cyient Semiconductors signs a definitive agreement to acquire a majority stake in Kinetic Technologies for up to **$93 million**.
- The move aims to create a scaled platform in the **power semiconductor market** and expand Cyient's capabilities in *power management ICs* and analogue/mixed-signal tech.
- The deal broadens Cyient's reach across data centers, electrification, automotive and edge AI compute.

items.title: Patel to revive Gongri 144 MW project
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The MoU with the Government of *Arunachal Pradesh* will revive the **Gongri Hydropower Project** (144 MW) under the state's policy for stalled large hydropower projects.
- The ₹1,700 crore project will be built on a *build-own-operate-transfer (BOOT)* model, with Patel Engineering operating for 40 years before transfer.
- This revival aligns with Arunachal Pradesh's **Decade of Hydropower** plan to unlock renewable energy potential and address legacy project issues.

items.title: MTAR Technologies bags ₹310 crore nuclear equipment order from Megha Engineering
AM Green, Mitsui join hands to explore low-carbon aluminium opportunities
Nitin Jain quits OfBusiness to start manufacturing venture
items.summary:
- *Nitin Jain*, cofounder and CBO of *OfBusiness* and its lending arm *Oxyzo*, is quitting to start a manufacturing-focused venture, announced on LinkedIn.
- He had previously stepped down as CBO and later rejoined amid negotiations with investors for his new venture.
- *OfBusiness*, founded in 2015, posted 2023-24 growth and last raised funding in 2021 with a **$325M** round led by **Alpha Wave Global**, **Tiger Global**, and **SoftBank Vision Fund**.

items.title: Indian Railways nears complete electrification; hits 99.2% of broad gauge network, ahead of UK, Russia & China
India trusted supplier of quality medicines: Rajesh Agrawal
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- India is a *trusted global supplier* of quality and affordable medicines, with exports crossing **$30 billion** in the last fiscal. 
- It is the world's third largest pharma producer by volume, reaching over *200 markets*, with the US at about **34%** and Europe around **19%** of exports. 
- The domestic market is about *$60 billion*, expected to reach *$130 billion* by 2030, signaling strong *long-term growth*.

items.title: NTPC adds ~360 MW solar; group hits 85.5 GW
items.summary:
- NTPC added **359.585 MW** of solar capacity via subsidiaries in Gujarat and Rajasthan, taking group commercial capacity to **85.541 GW**.
- CODs include **243.66 MW** at Khavda-I (Gujarat), **78 MW** at Nokh (Rajasthan), and **37.925 MW** from Khavda Solar Energy Project (Gujarat).
- NTPC targets **60 GW** renewables by 2032, accounts for about one-quarter of India's power, with **30.9 GW** under construction including **13.3 GW** renewables.

items.title: Green manufacturing a business imperative
items.summary:
- *Green manufacturing* is a business imperative for *Tamil Nadu*’s competitiveness, highlighted by experts at an MCC&I seminar.
- The event notes UK–TN collaboration on climate action, a green rating framework, offshore wind, and heat resilience initiatives.
- Government support includes a 25% capital subsidy for green tech, energy audits, and guidance for MSMEs on carbon footprints and the circular economy.

items.title: SpiceJet orders 100 Natilus jets in India entry
items.summary:
- SpiceJet has ordered 100 **Natilus** blended-wing jets as it marks entry into India and launches a local subsidiary.
- Natilus is considering India for a manufacturing facility to build roughly 300 **HORIZON** jets, with Natilus India headquartered in Mumbai.
- SpiceJet will work with Natilus to secure certification in India and source components locally once regulatory hurdles are cleared.

items.title: Titagarh wins ₹273cr RBMV contract with Indian Railways
items.summary:
- TRSL wins a ₹273.24-crore contract from **Indian Railways** to design, manufacture, supply, test and commission *Rail Borne Maintenance Vehicles (RBMV)*.
- It marks TRSL's maiden entry into the safety and signalling segment, with **training** and ongoing maintenance support for Indian Railways.
- The RBMV on-track machines are for inspection, maintenance and restoration of railway infrastructure, integrating advanced systems for track work and OHE to boost safety and reliability.

items.title: Vedanta plans to invest $20 billion in India in 4-5 years: Anil Agarwal
India to have at least 5 indigenous SMRs
items.author: Atul Mathur
items.summary:
- India aims to deploy at least five indigenously designed *SMRs* by 2033, led by the *Bhabha Atomic Research Centre*. 
- The government has allocated **₹20,000 crore** in the 2025-26 budget for SMR research, design, development, and deployment. 
- India currently has 8.78 GW of capacity and aims to reach about **100 GW** by 2047, with *NPCIL* expanding capacity through collaborations.

items.title: Explained: The Nuclear Energy Bill, 2025 — safety, liability and the push for 100 GW
Attero to invest ₹150-crore for capacity expansion
items.author: Muntazir Abbas
items.summary:
*- Attero to invest **₹150 crore** to add 100,000 tonnes per year, taking total capacity to **244,000 tpa** and adding about **800 jobs**.*
*- Expansion across four sites — **Pune, Bengaluru, Faridabad and Jaipur** — with a focus on **robotics, automation** and **advanced recovery tech**, supported by the Greater Noida R&D Centre.*
*- Revenue grew to **₹1,000 crore** in FY2025 from **₹440 crore** in FY2024, with plans for international **dismantling & Li-ion battery recycling** facilities and patent-backed growth.*

items.title: Ambrane opens Haryana plant; ₹50cr investment, 200% capacity
items.summary:
- **Ambrane** has started operations at an 83,000 sq ft automated manufacturing facility in Kundli, Haryana, built with ₹50cr investment.
- The new plant is set to boost production by **200%** and support entry into *IT peripherals* and small appliances.
- About 600+ workers are employed locally, with ongoing skill development and planned hiring in R&D, quality and manufacturing.

items.title: Tatas bet big on iPhone, infuse ₹1,500 crore more in electronics business
Satcom firms must secure clearances before launch: Scindia
items.author: Himanshi Lohchab, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Satellite-communication operators will need to secure *security clearances* and host international gateways in India before commercial services go live.
- The policy framework is in place, with next steps on *spectrum assignment* and *security compliance* before licensed operators launch.
- Three licences have been issued to Starlink, OneWeb and Reliance, with DoT spectrum allocation and TRAI pricing framework to follow.
